meanings.definition: A point of time, especially one made critical or important by a concurrence of circumstances.
meanings.sent1: At the juncture of the meeting, decisions were made.
meanings.sent2: The juncture of the clock striking midnight marked the new year.
meanings.sent3: At the juncture of the play, the unexpected twist left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The juncture of fate and opportunity led to a life-changing decision.
meanings.sent5: The juncture of the storm and the wedding created chaos and memories.

meanings.sent1: The juncture of the two rivers formed a beautiful confluence.
meanings.sent2: At the juncture of the roads, we had to choose our path.
meanings.sent3: The juncture of the puzzle pieces finally revealed the hidden image.
meanings.sent4: The juncture of the branches created a natural archway in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The juncture of the train tracks symbolized the meeting of two journeys.
